extendedIngredients.name: dark chocolate bar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3.5 oz. dark chocolate bar, cut into ½" chunks

extendedIngredients.name: dark chocolate bar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3.5 oz. white chocolate bar, cut into ½" chunks

extendedIngredients.name: unsalted butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ c. unsalted butter (1 stick), softened

recipes.title: Black and White Chocolate Cookies

winePairing.pairingText: Cookies can be paired with Cream Sherry, Madeira, and Prosecco. Sweet bubbly Prosecco doesn't overwhelm simple sugar or shortbread cookies, a sweet cream sherry complements spiced cookies, and madeira's nutty notes match cookies with nuts perfectly. You could try NV Solera Cream Sherry. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.Cream together butter and sugar until fluffy in a stand mixer on medium-low speed or by hand.Add egg and vanilla, and continue mixing until smooth.In a medium bowl, stir together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt. Add dry ingredients to butter mixture, and mix on low speed (or stir) until combined. Dough will be very stiff.Add chocolate chunks, and stir to incorporate.Line two baking sheets with silicone mats or parchment paper. Use a large cookie scoop to place cookies about 2" apart on prepared baking sheets. Bake for 12 minutes, or until centers are set.Cool for a few minutes on the pan, then transfer to wire rack to cool completely.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.Cream together butter and sugar until fluffy in a stand mixer on medium-low speed or by hand.
Add egg and vanilla, and continue mixing until smooth.In a medium bowl, stir together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add dry ingredients to butter mixture, and mix on low speed (or stir) until combined. Dough will be very stiff.
Add chocolate chunks, and stir to incorporate.Line two baking sheets with silicone mats or parchment paper. Use a large cookie scoop to place cookies about 2" apart on prepared baking sheets.
Bake for 12 minutes, or until centers are set.Cool for a few minutes on the pan, then transfer to wire rack to cool completely.
